page.title: 11New Churches at Over Hulton
page.content:
{St.Vincent's R.C.Church}on New Brook Rd. was opened in l969 in a dual purpose building which is used as church and parish hall. This is now too small to serve the 700 catholics of this parish so a new church is being built at a cost of Â£200,000. It will open for worship in December 1985 Approx. 400 people representing every age group attend 10a.m.mass on Sundays
{St.Andrew's Church}was opened in l977 replacing the earlier building of 1887 Family Service at 10a.m. every Sunday is the most popular service. It is a thriving church and has its own primary school, many of the pupils attending the church and Sunday School as well as Brownies, Guides, Cubs and Scouts. The school is a one-form entry but falling rolls have reduced numbers to almost half its capacity.
